TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ConfigErrorGlyph extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides a glyph for an to display when a user has not performed required designer actions at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Activity designers use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConfigErrorGlyph> to display actions associated with smart tags on the designer surface. For example, if an activity requires users to set a property, the activity designer displays <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConfigErrorGlyph> to help notify them that they are required to set the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConfigErrorGlyph.OnActivate%2A> is called, the designer verbs associated with the glyph are displayed on the activity designer surface.
